content.description:
This route climbs a lower panel of clean gator skin to a steeper upper half with a crack.

Per

ANGUS WIESSNER

: avoid gear behind the flake. Once atop the flake, sling a chickenhead, and climb to the anchor. Be careful on this route, the foothold my partner was standing on blew and could have hit me while belaying.
content.protection:
Pro to 2 1/2", chains at the top.

Per

ANGUS WIESSNER

: offset stoppers were nice plus two draws for the two bolt anchor.
content.location:
West side of the Alligator Lounge, left of

Lator Gator

. The lower half may test your gear placement skills.

content.description: Four sticky feet would certainly help you on this steep route!  Instead you will have to fire the long crux move and be efficient with gear spotting/placement as you pass through a smattering of jugs to reach the vertical face above.  From here, angle towards a pillar below the right side of the looming roofs above.  An airy traverse left through the overlaps deposits you at the anchors.
content.protection: A single bolt keeps you off the deck during the crux move.  Otherwise, an emphasis on thin fingers, and a single rack up to fists.  2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
Once you have found the Swamp alcove, locate the wall with

Bury The Bone

on it.  This route sits on the far right side of the same wall.

content.description: Climb a steep finger crack in a dihedral. This has good stemming - with tight fingers. This is a short but very sweet pitch.
content.protection: Finger size for the route, larger to set up the belay.  Walk off.
content.location: It is on the back side of The Lounge.
